metadata.title: CVE-2014-8866 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The compatibility mode hypercall argument translation in Xen 3.3.x through4.4.x, when running on a 64-bit hypervisor, allows local 32-bit HVM gueststo cause a denial of service (host crash) via vectors involving alteringthe high halves of registers while in 64-bit mode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-utils-common - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xenstore-utils - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
